m_szDocTitle: Toyota to take part in making wind-power hydrogen for fuel cells ‹ Japan Today: Japan News and Discussion
m_szDocSumamry: A Toyota fuel cell forklift, right, and a truck designed for hydrogen fueling station and carrying hydrogen, background, are displayed in Yokohama on Monday. AP Photo/Shizuo Kambayashi YOKOHAMA, Japan — Toyota Motor Corp is responding to the main criticism of fuel cell cars, that making the hydrogen for the fuel is not clean, with plans to help make the hydrogen using wind power. Fuel cells are zero-emission, running on the power created when hydrogen combines with oxygen in the air to make water.
